skill.name: gh-address-comments
skill.description: Help address review/issue comments on the open GitHub PR for the current branch using gh CLI; verify gh auth first and prompt the user to authenticate if not logged in.
skill.summary: Help address review/issue comments on the open GitHub PR for the current branch using gh CLI; verify...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based skill containing only markdown instructions for guiding an AI assistant. No executable code, no file system access beyond reading this skill file, and no direct network or command execution. All operations are delegated to the trusted gh CLI tool which requires explicit user authentication.

content.value_statement: Managing PR review feedback is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill fetches all comments from your GitHub PR, presents them numbered for easy reference, and helps you apply fixes efficiently with gh CLI integration.
actual_capabilities: Fetch all comments and review threads from the open PR using gh CLI
Number and summarize each comment with fix requirements
Present options to the user for selecting comments to address
Apply fixes for selected comments through gh CLI
Handle authentication prompts for gh CLI access
limitations: Requires gh CLI to be installed and authenticated
Cannot automatically resolve comments requiring human judgment
Network access required for GitHub API calls
Only works with GitHub repositories using gh CLI

use_cases.title: Streamline code review feedback
use_cases.description: Efficiently address PR comments by seeing all feedback in one place and applying fixes systematically.

use_cases.title: Track review progress
use_cases.description: Monitor which comments have been addressed and ensure all feedback is resolved before merging.

use_cases.title: Handle maintainer feedback
use_cases.description: Process reviewer comments on your pull requests without missing any important feedback items.

prompt_templates.title: Fetch PR comments
prompt_templates.prompt: Use gh-address-comments to fetch all review comments from the current branch PR.

prompt_templates.title: Review and select
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me all pending comments and let me select which ones to fix.

prompt_templates.title: Apply fixes
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply fixes for comments 1, 3, and 5 from the list.

prompt_templates.title: Full workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the full gh-address-comments workflow to handle all pending review comments on this PR.

output_examples.input: Use gh-address-comments to fetch and address PR comments
output: Comment #1: Fix typo in variable name 'usename' â†’ 'username' (easy)
Comment #2: Add null check for user input (medium)
Comment #3: Update documentation for API endpoint (easy)

best_practices: Run 'gh auth login' before starting to ensure CLI access works properly
Review all comments first before selecting which to address
Handle authentication issues promptly by re-running 'gh auth login'
Check rate limits if processing many comments on large PRs
anti_patterns: Starting without verifying gh authentication status first
Attempting to address all comments without reviewing them systematically
Ignoring authentication or rate limit errors mid-workflow
Using this skill for non-GitHub repository hosting services

faq.question: Does this work with GitHub Enterprise Server?
faq.answer: Yes, if gh CLI is configured for your Enterprise Server instance and you have authenticated access.

faq.question: What if gh CLI is not installed?
faq.answer: Install gh CLI from cli.github.com or via your package manager before using this skill.

faq.question: Can I address comments on forks?
faq.answer: Yes, if you have authenticated access to the fork and permissions to push changes.

faq.question: Is my GitHub token stored securely?
faq.answer: All authentication is handled by gh CLI directly. Tokens are stored per gh CLI configuration.

faq.question: What happens if I hit rate limits?
faq.answer: The skill will prompt you to wait or retry. Consider using a GitHub token with higher limits.

faq.question: How is this different from GitHub's native review tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides an AI-assisted workflow to fetch, organize, and apply comment fixes locally.
